poem:
Release

In the thin dawn, 
a child's cry echoes— 
not heard by saints 
nor sinners. The gate 
opens for a wolf 
disguised, prowling 
where innocence 
once played. Society's 
lax grip excuses, 
fingers loosing— 
the aftermath of 
injustice glistening 
on the tender grass. 
Who will tend 
the garden now?
